00031 /// @file xed-disas.h
00032 /// @author Mark Charney <mark.charney@intel.com>
00033 
00034 #if !defined(_XED_DISAS_H_)
00035 # define _XED_DISAS_H_
00036 
00037 #include "xed-types.h"
00038 
00039 /// @ingroup PRINT
00040 /// A #xed_disassembly_callback_fn_t takes an address, a pointer to a
00041 /// symbol buffer of buffer_length bytes, and a pointer to an offset. The
00042 /// function fills in the symbol_buffer and sets the offset to the desired
00043 /// offset for that symbol.  If the function succeeds, it returns 1. 
00044 //  The call back should return 0 if the buffer is not long enough to
00045 //  include the null termination.If no symbolic information is
00046 //  located, the function returns zero.
00047 ///  @param address The input address for which we want symbolic name and offset
00048 ///  @param symbol_buffer A buffer to hold the symbol name. The callback function should fill this in and terminate
00049 ///                       with a null byte.
00050 ///  @param buffer_length The maximum length of the symbol_buffer including then null
00051 ///  @param offset A pointer to a xed_uint64_t to old the offset from the provided symbol.
00052 ///  @param context This void* pointer passed to the disassembler's new interface so that the caller can identify 
00053 ///                     the proper context against which to resolve the symbols. 
00054 ///                     The disassembler passes this value to
00055 ///                     the callback. The legacy formatters 
00056 ///                     that do not have context will pass zero for this parameter.
00057 ///  @return 0 on failure, 1 on success.
00058 typedef  int XED_DLL_EXPORT (*xed_disassembly_callback_fn_t)(
00059     xed_uint64_t  address,
00060     char*         symbol_buffer,
00061     xed_uint32_t  buffer_length,
00062     xed_uint64_t* offset,
00063     void*         context);
00064 
00065 /// @ingroup PRINT
00066 /// Register a disassembly call back function of type
00067 /// #xed_disassembly_callback_fn_t to get called when the disassembler
00068 /// needs to get a symbol and offset for an address.
00069 XED_DLL_EXPORT void xed_register_disassembly_callback(xed_disassembly_callback_fn_t f);
00070 
00071 #endif
